abstract: China’s Pres Xi Jinping will help United Nations reach goal to eliminate extreme poverty by 2030 by pledging initial $2 billion for development assistance and increasing aid over next 15 years to $12 billion; critics say China’s development assistance is self-serving, pointing to their aid in Africa as way to access fuel sources.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Xi told the United Nations that China would pledge $2 billion as an initial investment for development assistance to the poorest countries.

headline.main: President Xi Jinping of China Pledges $2 Billion to Fight Poverty
headline.print_headline: President of China Pledges $2 Billion to Fight Poverty

snippet: Mr. Xi told the United Nations that China would pledge $2 billion as an initial investment for development assistance to the poorest countries.
